primObj: To determine if there is a statistically significant relationship between the change in both ADAS-Cog and CIBIC+ scores, and drug dose (0, 50 cm2 [54 mg], and 75 cm2 [81 mg])
secObj: To assess the dose-dependent improvement in behavior. Improved scores on the Revised Neuropsychiatric Inventory (NPI-X) will indicate improvement in these areas.
studyStopRuleDsc: Last patient completed last visit or sponsor decided to discontinue study
studyTitle: Safety and Efficacy of the Xanomeline Transdermal Therapeutic System (TTS) in Patients with Mild to Moderate Alzheimers Disease.

primObj: To document the safety profile of the xanomeline TTS.
secObj: To assess the dose-dependent improvements in activities of daily living. Improved scores on the Disability Assessment for Dementia (DAD) will indicate improvement in these areas.
studyStopRuleDsc: Last patient completed last visit or sponsor decided to discontinue study
studyTitle: Safety and Efficacy of the Xanomeline Transdermal Therapeutic System (TTS) in Patients with Mild to Moderate Alzheimers Disease.

primObj: Evaluate the efficacy and safety of transdermal xanomeline, 50cm2 and 75cm2, and placebo in subjects with mild to moderate Alzheimer's disease.
secObj: To assess the dose-dependent improvements in an extended assessment of cognition that integrates attention/concentration tasks. The ADAS-Cog (14) will be used for this assessment.
studyStopRuleDsc: Last patient completed last visit or sponsor decided to discontinue study
studyTitle: Safety and Efficacy of the Xanomeline Transdermal Therapeutic System (TTS) in Patients with Mild to Moderate Alzheimers Disease.

secObj: To assess the treatment response as a function of Apo E genotype.
